alert.note: Alert for Donley; Gray (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 9:38PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Armstrong, south central Gray and northwestern Donley Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 938 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles east of Goodnight, or 13 miles northwest of Clarendon, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Howardwick, Lake Mcclellan, Greenbelt Lake and Goodnight. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
